channel.title: DTO
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from DTO, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Dollar Tree sells Family Dollar, why the $8.5B deal a decade ago didn't work
Trump commutes sentence of Ozy Media founder Carlos Watson just before prison surrender
item.description: Ozy had falsely claimed to have deals with Google and Oprah Winfrey before the company and CEO Watson were criminally charged.

item.title: Women’s March Madness ratings dip without Caitlin Clark. It’s not a doom signal.
Trump pardons Nikola founder Trevor Milton in securities fraud case
item.description: Milton, who compared his prosecution by the Justice Department to its criminal cases against President Trump, said he had been "railroaded" in the fra...

item.title: Trump pardons three BitMEX crypto exchange co-founders, and ex-employee
item.description: Trevor Milton, founder and former CEO of electric truck maker Nikola, revealed that Trump had pardoned him for his criminal conviction for securities ...

item.title: Trump warns automakers not to hike prices. What power do presidents have?
Elon Musk is folding X into his AI ambitions
Trump sued by two more 'Big Law' firms he targeted in executive orders
item.description: The law firms WilmerHale, Jenner & Block and Perkins Coie say President Trump's orders violate the U.S. Constitution.

item.title: As stocks plummet to end the week, ‘stagflation’ fears are back in the spotlight
Trump says Skadden, Arps law firm will provide $100 million in pro bono legal services, avoiding executive order
item.description: Earlier, two "Big Law" firms sued the Trump administration over the president's executive orders targeting them.
